metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26145 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered on Samsung Galaxy S3 i9305 4.4.4 devices. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, and WPA3 implementations accept second (or subsequent) broadcast fragments even when sent in plaintext and process them as full unfragmented frames. An adversary can abuse this to inject arbitrary network packets independent of the network configuration. Mathy Vanhoef discovered that the Linux kernelâ€™s WiFi implementation accepted plaintext fragments in certain situations. A physically proximate attacker could use this issue to inject packets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-5.19.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1028-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required
